sentences.english: Today, there are thousands of women players in the Chinese Football Association.
sentences.chinese: 现在有上千女足球运动员在中国足协。

sentences.english: Yes. You may find the logo of the Chinese Football Association on each of them.
sentences.chinese: 有的，我们每件行李上都贴有中国足球协会的会标。

sentences.english: Several senior officials from the Chinese Football Association have been arrested over match-fixing allegations.
sentences.chinese: 几名中国足协的高官由于操纵假球受到指控并被逮捕。

sentences.english: The corridors of the CFA are eerily quiet.
sentences.chinese: 中国足协办公楼的走廊平静得可怕。

sentences.english: New soccer leader named in scandal-rocked CFA.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻轰动的中国足协任命新的掌门人。

sentences.english: China's soccer team, by contrast, is a perennial disappointment.
sentences.chinese: 相比较而言，中国国足却叫中国人连年失望。

sentences.english: Chinese male football team matched against Brail politely in 08 games.
sentences.chinese: 在08奥运会上，中国足球队很礼貌地和巴西竞赛。

sentences.english: I hope the team of China will be a strong team one day.
sentences.chinese: 我希望中国足球队终有一天成为强队。

definition: abbr. for 男子足球 men's soccer/abbr. for 男子足球隊|男子足球队 men's soccer team
Hao Haidong (1970-), former Chinese soccer player
North Korea/Korea as geographic term/Taiwan pr. [Chao2 xian1]
Sun Jihai (1977-), Chinese footballer, played for Manchester City (2002-2008)
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
host/official host (e.g. venue for games or a conference)
